historia.contenido: According to oral tradition, this waterfall witnessed ancient union rituals between couples seeking to bless their love with the strength of water and nature. It is said that its waters hold the whispers of eternal promises, and those who approach with a sincere heart can feel the energy of the lovers who once sealed their destiny here.

leyenda.titulo: The Stone That Cries on Full Moon
leyenda.contenido: The elders say that during full moons, the stone 'cries' dewdrops that have healing properties. The legend says it was a Mixe princess turned to stone by the gods to protect her people, and her tears are blessings for visitors with pure hearts.
leyenda.moral: Sacrifice for the community is eternally remembered

testimonios.testimonio: My grandfather told me that his great-grandfather witnessed how the first Spaniards tried to move the stone but couldn't. He said the earth itself protected it.
When studying the engravings, we discovered they coincide with specific astronomical events. The precision is amazing considering the era.

historia.contenido: This centuries-old ahuehuete was planted in 1845 by the first municipal president of San Juan Tahitic. Crucial decisions were made under its shade during the Mexican Revolution, and it served as a meeting point for revolutionaries in the region.
historia.significadoCultural: Symbol of resistance and community unity

leyenda.contenido: Tradition says that if you whisper a secret to the tree and it moves its leaves, your wish will come true. Many couples have come here to promise eternal love, and the elders assure that the tree keeps the secrets of entire generations.

testimonios.testimonio: Every year on the town's anniversary, children surround the tree to sing to it. They say when its branches move, it's because it's answering them.

historia.contenido: This 18th-century adobe house housed for generations the Martínez family, recognized weavers who preserved pre-Hispanic textile techniques. The walls preserve natural pigments used to dye the threads, and the original backstrap loom is still in use.

leyenda.titulo: The Loom That Sings at Night
leyenda.contenido: It is said that on full moon nights, the ancient loom 'sings' with the sound of its threads moving alone. Neighbors assure it is the spirit of great-grandmother Elena, who swore to continue weaving until her designs were known worldwide.
